channel.title: VirtualBox on Faizar Septiawan - Palugada paling ganteng di Makassar
channel.description: Recent content in VirtualBox on Faizar Septiawan - Palugada paling ganteng di Makassar

item.title: How to compact VirtualBox's VDI file size?
item.description: On guest OS or VM dd if=/dev/zero of=/var/tmp/bigemptyfile bs=4096k ; rm /var/tmp/bigemptyfile sudo poweroff On Host OS VBoxManage modifymedium \ "/media/sibunglon/Data/VirtualBox VMs/Local Develoment/dependency/dependency.vdi" \ --compact

item.title: Resize LVM Space
item.description: Use Space from Extended Physical (or Virtual) Disk ubuntu@ubuntu:~$ lsblk NAME MAJ:MIN RM SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINT loop0 7:0 0 55.6M 1 loop /snap/core18/2654 loop1 7:1 0 63.2M 1 loop /snap/core20/1695 loop2 7:2 0 63.2M 1 loop /snap/core20/1738 loop3 7:3 0 91.8M 1 loop /snap/lxd/23991 loop4 7:4 0 55.6M 1 loop /snap/core18/2632 loop5 7:5 0 49.6M 1 loop /snap/snapd/17883 loop6 7:6 0 91.9M 1 loop /snap/lxd/24061 sda 8:0 0 70G 0 disk ├─sda1 8:1 0 1M 0 part ├─sda2 8:2 0 1G 0 part /boot └─sda3 8:3 0 69G 0 part └─ubuntu--vg-ubuntu--lv 253:0 0 69G 0 lvm / sr0 11:0 1 1024M 0 rom ubuntu@ubuntu:~$ On this case, LVM partition it is under sda3 and let’s start with extended or resize disk.
